subject: awkward mock objects
msgSnippet: Speaking of mock objects, I needed to test some objects that initialized themselves from a JDBC ResultSet.  Rather than generate a test table and stuff data
messageBody:
how to setup tests in a server environment?
Speaking of mock objects, I needed to test some objects that initialized themselves from a JDBC ResultSet.  Rather than generate a test table and stuff data into it, I decided to create a MockResultSet.  Well, ResultSet is an interface with a LOT of methods.  What a boring chore this turned out to be.  In the end, I created an AbstractMockResultSet class that throws an SQLException for every method.  If anyone needs such a thing, let me know and it could save you a lot of typing.
 
 - George
-----Original Message-----
From: Erik Meade [mailto:emeade@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 15, 2001 10:43 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] how to setup tests in a server environment?

Would it be easier to mock up the data accessing services?
